title: Following the Australian Open: BBC Coverage Guide
summary: The Australian Open, a premier Grand Slam tennis tournament, commences on January 18 and concludes on February 1 at Melbourne Park in Melbourne, Australia. This article details how to follow the event across BBC platforms, emphasizing comprehensive coverage for audiences. Key players include defending champions Jannik Sinner in the men's singles and Madison Keys in the women's singles, with notable challengers such as Carlos Alcaraz, Novak Djokovic, and Aryna Sabalenka. The BBC offers live radio commentary via BBC Radio 5 Live, BBC Sounds, and BBC iPlayer, ensuring real-time updates. Additionally, daily programming like Tennis Breakfast on BBC Radio 5 Sports Extra provides morning analysis and discussion, while special evening shows air on select dates. The article also mentions qualifying rounds and final schedules, highlighting the tournament's structure. This guide aims to inform viewers about accessing matches and related content, enhancing their viewing experience through reliable broadcasting.
